page.title: 19HOUSING IN STAMBOURNE
page.content: There are about 6 council houses in this area of Stambourne: all the others are in private ownership. There are some farmhouses and cottages dating from the 16th & 17th centuries, more from the 18th & early 19th centuries. Very few buildings date from the period 1850-1950. There is considerable modern development in Dyer's End and Chapel End Way, much of it bungalows, with more houses in Dyer's End. Under Essex County Council planning regulations, new building is allowed only in the gaps between existing houses - infill development. This prevents encroachment on open countryside, but can lead to cramped development in the village area.
